titlepage.titleproper:
Finding Aid for
John B. Trevor, Jr. Papers, 1939-1987
titlepage.author:
Finding aid prepared by:
Bentley Historical Library staff

did.abstract: John B. Trevor was active in various local (New York state) and national conservative and patriotic organizations; topical files, 1930s-1970s, contain correspondence, published materials, clippings, and ephemera detailing his interest in, and involvement with, such organizations as the Sons of the American Revolution and the American Coalition of Patriotic Societies.
did.physloc: Offsite storage; prior notification required for access

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The Trevor papers were given to Dr. John Tanton (Donor no. 7087) who donated them to the library in August 2000. Additional materials were received in 2010.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., John B. Trevor, Jr. Papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: John B. Trevor, Jr. was involved in a variety of immigration reform and patriotic organizations. He was, for example, a member of the advisory board of the Cooper-Hewitt Museum of Design, treasurer of the Empire State Society of the Sons of the American Revolution, treasurer of the Committee of Episcopal Laymen of New York, treasurer of the Pioneer Fund, as well as being active in the American Coalition of Patriotic Societies.

scopecontent.p: The papers of John B. Trevor, Jr. consist of correspondence and collected materials relating to his activities with various patriotic organizations, including the American Coalition, the Sons of the American Revolution, and the Pioneer Fund.
